summary: This bill, introduced in the U.S. Senate, mandates the President to designate Ansarallah as a foreign terrorist organization within 30 days of the bill's enactment. It further requires the President, within 30 days of that designation, to determine if specific individuals (Abdul Malik al-Houthi, Abd al-Khaliq Badr al-Din al-Houthi, and Abdullah Yahya al-Hakim) are officials, agents, or affiliates of Ansarallah. The bill defines Ansarallah as the movement also known as the Houthi movement and any of its aliases. The bill's intent is to impose sanctions on this organization for acts of international terrorism.
